title: Sure, here is a reading list of 20 articles that cover various aspects of evaluating large language models (LLMs), including methodologies, metrics, and issues in evaluation. These articles span different dimensions such as performance, fairness, robustness, and ethical considerations
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** by Jacob Devlin et al
Discusses the evaluation of BERT, a foundational LLM, and introduces various benchmarks
**"Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"** by Tom B. Brown et al
Evaluates GPT-3's performance across a wide range of tasks using few-shot learning
**"Evaluating the Text-to-Text Transfer Transformer (T5)"** by Colin Raffel et al
Provides a comprehensive evaluation of T5 across multiple NLP tasks
**"Beyond Accuracy: Behavioral Testing of NLP Models with CheckList"** by Marco Tulio Ribeiro et al
Introduces CheckList, a tool for behavioral testing of NLP models, and discusses its application to LLMs
**"GLUE: A Multi-Task Benchmark and Analysis Platform for Natural Language Understanding"** by Alex Wang et al
Presents the GLUE benchmark for evaluating the performance of LLMs on a variety of NLU tasks
**"SuperGLUE: A Stickier Benchmark for General-Purpose Language Understanding Systems"** by Alex Wang et al
An extension of GLUE, providing a more challenging benchmark for LLM evaluation
**"Adversarial Examples for Evaluating Reading Comprehension Systems"** by Robin Jia and Percy Liang
Discusses the use of adversarial examples to evaluate the robustness of reading comprehension models
**"On the Dangers of Stochastic Parrots: Can Language Models Be Too Big?"** by Emily Bender et al
Explores ethical and societal implications of large language models, including evaluation challenges
**"Measuring Massive Multitask Language Understanding"** by Dan Hendrycks et al
Introduces the MMLU benchmark for evaluating LLMs on a wide range of tasks
**"Unsupervised Cross-lingual Representation Learning at Scale"** by Alexis Conneau et al
Evaluates cross-lingual LLMs and introduces the XLM-R model
**"Evaluating Large Language Models Trained on Code"** by Mark Chen et al
Discusses the evaluation of Codex, an LLM trained on code, and its performance on programming tasks
**"The GEM Benchmark: Natural Language Generation, its Evaluation and Metrics"** by Sebastian Gehrmann et al
Introduces the GEM benchmark for evaluating natural language generation models
**"Fairness and Abstraction in Sociotechnical Systems"** by Selbst et al
Discusses fairness in AI systems, including LLMs, and the challenges in evaluating fairness
**"Robustness Gym: Unifying the NLP Evaluation Landscape"** by Suchin Gururangan et al
Proposes a framework for evaluating the robustness of NLP models, including LLMs
**"Evaluating Gender Bias in Machine Translation"** by Rachel B. Rudinger et al
Examines gender bias in machine translation models and proposes evaluation methods
**"The Ethics of AI Ethics: An Evaluation of Guidelines"** by Brent Mittelstadt
Evaluates various ethical guidelines for AI, including considerations for LLMs
**"Evaluating the Robustness of Neural Language Models to Input Perturbations"** by Eric Wallace et al
Investigates the robustness of LLMs to various input perturbations
**"A Survey on Evaluation Methods for Dialogue Systems"** by Milica Gasic and Steve Young
Reviews evaluation methods for dialogue systems, relevant for conversational LLMs
**"Evaluating the Calibration of Deep Learning Models"** by Chuan Guo et al
Discusses methods for evaluating the calibration of deep learning models, including LLMs
**"The State of AI Ethics Report"** by The Montreal AI Ethics Institute
Provides an overview of ethical considerations in AI, including the evaluation of LLMs
These articles should provide a comprehensive understanding of the various dimensions and challenges involved in evaluating large language models
